EUNITILE A1.name: EUNITILE A1
EUNITILE A1.description: EUNITILE A1 is a cement-based, standard-performance tile adhesive for fixing ceramic tiles on stable surfaces like concrete or plaster. It offers reliable adhesion and slip resistance, ideal for light-traffic, low-moisture areas such as living rooms, bedrooms, and corridors.
uses: Fixing ceramic tiles efficiently and securely
Internal and external applications in residential or commercial areas
Stable substrates such as concrete, cement plaster, and masonry
Both wall and floor tiling installations
Areas with light to medium foot traffic
Surfaces free from major thermal or structural movement
advantages: Ready to use; just add water
Suitable for wall and floor applications
Reliable adhesion on stable concrete or plaster surfaces
Adequate open time for standard tiling applications
Economical and ideal for general-purpose tiling
EUNITILE A1.standard: BS EN 12004:2017 Class C1T (Normal adhesion, slip-resistant tile adhesive)
EUNITILE A1.mixing: Add 5.0–5.5 liters of clean, cool water per 25 kg bag of EUNITILE A1
EUNITILE A1.coverage: 5.0–5.5 m² per 25 kg bag at a 3 mm thickness
EUNITILE A1.packaging: 25 kg multi-layer paper bags with an inner moisture barrier
EUNITILE A1.storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C) under moisture-free conditions. Shelf life: 12 months from production date.
EUNITILE A1.healthSafety: Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for detailed information.

EUNITILE A1+.name: EUNITILE A1+
EUNITILE A1+.description: EUNITILE A1+ is a general-purpose, cementitious tile adhesive with reduced slip and extended open time. It provides excellent workability, precise tile placement, and durable adhesion on stable substrates such as concrete, cement plaster, or screeds.
uses: Fixing ceramic tiles efficiently and securely
Suitable for both internal and external use in residential or commercial areas
Applicable on stable substrates such as concrete, cement plaster, or masonry
Suitable for both wall and floor tiling installations
Ideal for areas with light to medium foot traffic
advantages: High impact resistance and increased durability
Easy to apply with good workability and extended open time
Strong adhesive bond strength for secure fixation
Non-sag formulation; suitable for use on walls and vertical surfaces
EUNITILE A1+.standard: BS EN 12004:2017 Class C1TE (Standard cementitious tile adhesive with reduced slip and extended open time)
EUNITILE A1+.mixing: Add 4.0–4.5 liters of fresh water per 20 kg bag
EUNITILE A1+.coverage: ~6.5 m² per 20 kg bag (depending on trowel size and substrate condition)
EUNITILE A1+.storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C). Shelf life: 12  months from production date.
EUNITILE A1+.healthSafety: Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS).

EUNITILE A2.name: EUNITILE A2
EUNITILE A2.description: EUNITILE A2 is a high-strength, cement-based tile adhesive with improved adhesion, suitable for challenging substrates such as existing tiles, concrete, cement screeds, and masonry. It provides excellent slip resistance, ideal for vertical applications, wet areas, heavy-traffic zones, and exterior façades.
uses: Fixing ceramic and porcelain tiles on challenging substrates
Internal and external applications
Walls and floors, including vertical installations
Wet areas including bathrooms, kitchens, balconies, and terraces
Large-format or heavy tiles
Heated floors and underfloor heating systems
Heavy traffic areas
advantages: Excellent slip resistance, ideal for vertical installation
Suitable for internal and external applications
Durable for wet areas and heavy traffic
EUNITILE A2.standard: BS EN 12004:2017 Class C2T (Improved adhesion, slip-resistant)
EUNITILE A2.mixing: Add 5.0–5.5 liters of fresh water per 25 kg bag
EUNITILE A2.storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C). Shelf life: 12 months.

EUNITILE A2(H).name: EUNITILE A2(H)
EUNITILE A2(H).description: EUNITILE A2(H) is a high-performance, cement-based, polymer-modified tile adhesive with improved adhesion, high slip resistance, and slight deformability. Suitable for ceramic, porcelain, and natural stone tiles on walls and floors, both indoors and outdoors.
uses: Bonding porcelain, large-format tiles, and natural stone
Can be applied on drywall
Ideal for slightly deformable substrates
Wet areas such as bathrooms and kitchens
Submerged conditions including swimming pools
Large-format tiles and heavy-duty applications
advantages: High adhesive bond strength and excellent durability
Easy to use with smooth workability
High water resistance; unaffected in submerged conditions
Non-sag properties for secure vertical tile fixing
Slight deformability (S1) to absorb minor movements
EUNITILE A2(H).mixing: Add ~6.0–6.5 L water per 25 kg bag
EUNITILE A2(H).storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C). Shelf life: 12 months.

EUNITILE GP.name: EUNITILE GP
EUNITILE GP.description: EUNITILE GP is a cement-based, general-purpose tile adhesive formulated for fixing ceramic tiles on interior wall and floor applications. It offers good workability, reliable adhesion, and ease of use for standard tiling works.
uses: Fixing ceramic wall and floor tiles
Application over concrete surfaces, cementitious screeds, plaster
Dry interior environments
Residential buildings, offices, commercial areas
EUNITILE GP.standard: ANSI A118.1 Standard for Non-Modified Dry-Set Cement Mortar
EUNITILE GP.storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C). Shelf life: 12 months.

EUNITILE A2 MAX.name: EUNITILE A2 MAX
EUNITILE A2 MAX.description: EUNITILE A2 MAX is a high-performance, two-component, polymer-modified cementitious tile adhesive designed for superior adhesion, extended open time, and exceptional slip resistance. Ideal for installing large-format tiles and natural stone.
uses: Fixing large-format tiles and natural stone
Tile-over-tile applications
Wet environments such as swimming pools
Vertical applications
High-traffic areas and floor heating systems
advantages: Excellent adhesion to various tiles and substrates
Superior long-term performance in submerged conditions
EUNITILE A2 MAX.mixing: As supplied (liquid polymer + powder), no water added
EUNITILE A2 MAX.coverage: ~8 m² per 25 kg at 2 mm layer thickness
EUNITILE A2 MAX.packaging: Part A: 20 kg set; Part B: 5 kg container
EUNITILE A2 MAX.storage: Store in a dry, cool area (5°C–40°C). Shelf life: 12 months.

EUNITILE G2.name: EUNITILE G2
EUNITILE G2.description: EUNITILE G2 is a high-performance cementitious tile grout with high abrasion resistance and reduced water absorption, suitable for both interior and exterior applications with all types of ceramic tiles, for joint widths up to 8mm.
uses: General-purpose colored grout for tile joints
Interior and exterior applications
Walls, floors, kitchens, and bathrooms
Compatible with all types of ceramic tiles
Joint widths up to 8 mm
EUNITILE G2.standard: ISO 13007-4, BS EN 13888: CG2 AW, ANSI A118.6
EUNITILE G2.mixing: Add 1.5–2 liters per 5 kg (all colors); for black: 2.25–2.5 liters per 5 kg
EUNITILE G2.storage: Store in a cool, dry place. Shelf life: 12 months.

EUNITILE G2 (H).name: EUNITILE G2 (H)
EUNITILE G2 (H).description: EUNITILE G2 (H) is an improved hydrophobic cementitious tile grout with high abrasion resistance. It is water-repellent and designed for use in submerged areas and swimming pools.
uses: Submerged areas and swimming pools
General use in wet and dry areas
Walls, floors, kitchens, and bathrooms
All types of tiles
Joint widths up to 10 mm
EUNITILE G2 (H).standard: ISO 13007-3, BS EN 13888 CG2 (AW), ANSI A118.6
EUNITILE G2 (H).storage: Store in a cool, dry place. Shelf life: 12 months.
